conclusion: Consider the motion of the circular ring through the magnetic field and the induced emf due to changing magnetic flux.
According to Faraday's Law, an emf is induced in a closed loop when the magnetic flux through the loop changes.
The magnetic flux through the loop when it is partially inside the magnetic field is given by B times the area inside.
The circle is partially inside the magnetic field with angle aOb = 90°, making the area inside a quarter-circle.
The area inside the magnetic field is A_inside = (1/4)πR².
The rate of change of the area inside the magnetic field is dA_inside/dt = vR.
The induced emf is calculated as -B * v * R.
The potential difference V_ab between points a and b is half the induced emf.
The potential difference between points a and b is V_ab = -(1/2)B * v * R.
